meanings.sent1: She misseats the guests at the party, causing confusion.
meanings.sent2: The waiter often misseats customers, leading to discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The misseated family ended up at the wrong table and laughed it off.
meanings.sent4: The misseated puzzle pieces didn't fit together properly.
meanings.sent5: The misseating of the actors on stage made the audience chuckle.

meanings.definition: To fail to seat someone properly.
meanings.sent1: He always misseats his friends at the movies, making them sit separately.
meanings.sent2: The airline staff occasionally misseats passengers due to overbooking.
meanings.sent3: The misseated group had to rearrange themselves awkwardly.
meanings.sent4: Her misseating of the doll in the tiny chair was comical.
meanings.sent5: The misseating error caused a delay in starting the event.

meanings.definition: To be seated in an incorrect or inappropriate manner.
meanings.sent1: The children misseated themselves at the table, causing a mess.
meanings.sent2: She misseats in the front row, blocking the view for others.
meanings.sent3: The misseated man accidentally sat on the armrest instead of the seat.
meanings.sent4: The misseated books on the shelf looked disorganized.
meanings.sent5: The misseating of the students led to a reshuffling of seats.
